page.title: 02MR BROMLEY PENNY'S LIFE.
page.content: {Mr. Bromley Penny}aged 85 has lived in{Watchet}all his life. His {Grandma}owned the{Post Office}and he can remember her telling him of how she had to write all the letters for the visiting illiterate seamen and ship's captains who regularly visited Watchet. She wrote to their companies and even wrote love letters. Mr. Penny's{father}owned a {tailors shop}in Swain Street where he employed 5 - 6 men and 5 women. He sold his suits all over the country. Mr. Penny remembers how the {streets}were so different when he was a boy, the road surface was covered in {dust or mud. } He went to a{school in Market St. which doesn't exist now. After he left school Mr. Penny worked in a{bank}in {Tiverton}where he had to cycle every Monday and return Friday.
